page.title: 16THE BATTLE OF HASTINGS CONT.
page.content: AND THE TWO ARMIES MET AT THE PLACE WHICH IS NOW CALLED BATTLE. THERE WERE ABOUT 7000 SOLDIERS ON EACH SIDE AND HAROLD LINED UP HIS MEN ON TOP OF A RIDGE.WILLIAM'S ARMY WHICH INCLUDED CAVALRY WAS ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE VALLEY.FIGHTING BEGAN ABOUT 9AM AND THE ENGLISH SHIELDWALL HELD FIRM. A RUMOUR WENT UP THAT WILLIAM WAS DEAD BUT HE REGROUPED HIS TROOPS,SHOWING HE WAS STILL ALIVE BY REMOVING HIS HELMET.THE CAVALRY ATTACKED THE SAXONS REPEATEDLY AND WILLIAM DECIDED TO TRY A FEIGNED FLIGHT TO DRAW THE SAXONS FROM THE RIDGE & IT WAS PARTLY SUCCESSFUL.THE NORMANS CONTINUED ATTACKING AND AT TWILIGHT AFTER HAROLD WAS SHOT IN THE EYE AND CUT TO PIECES BY NORMAN KNIGHTS,THE ENGLISH ARMY SCATTERED,CHASED BY THE NORMANS. WILLIAM WAS THE CONQUEROR OF ENGLAND.
